column4: my computer resolution and color setting are all messed and I have no OS installed
and it wont let me load anything with graphics
and its causing me not to be able to install ubuntu
you can install from the alt-install cd , it's a text based installer
could your video card be dying ?
or your monitor ?
still possible, that's what warranties are for
the problem would be the driver then, can you boot hte recovery mode and reset x ?
not even the recovery mode ?
have youtried booting the live cd , does the computer work with that ?
so the  live desktop session doesn't work for you ?
i,m thinking hardware problem here, I don'T think a reinstall will do anything
maybe the driver caused a problem and damaged your video chip  no idea ,
can you get in the bios ? is that display the way it should be ?
the bois had bad colours ? you have hardware problems , nothing to do with the os or the drivers
hardware problems you go to the store and ask for a replacement or sent it to the manufacturer for repair
assuming it 's still on warranty
no way to tell
there is only so much we can do for you online, you need someone knowlegable to look at your computer and see if they can'T find anything to be done with it
if your uni has a computer lab , ask them
I will never set foot in a future shop again
where are you located ?
seriously try to see i your uni as a computer deparment and find someoene there that can take a look at your comp
